title: Argentina wildfires create apocalyptic scene of blazes at a city’s edge
description: The fires were largely under control Wednesday, authorities said.

title: As Israel reels, Netanyahu agrees to share power with opposition party
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and former military Chief of Staff Benny Gantz signed an agreement late Wednesday to form a unity government to wage war against Hamas.

title: With Gaza and Israel at war, Palestinian Authority struggles to be heard
description: As Gaza prepares for what is expected to be an extensive Israeli ground invasion, the public absence of Palestinian political leadership is adding to the chaos.

title: Who are the Hamas leaders behind the attacks on Israel?
description: Israel said eliminating Hamas’s senior officials is a “top priority.” Here’s what to know about its key leaders, including Ismail Haniyeh and Mohammed Deif.

title: People from 23 countries killed, missing in Israel-Hamas war: What to know
description: People from the United States, France, Germany, Ukraine and other countries are caught up in the Israel-Hamas war. Some were killed and dozens remain unaccounted for.

title: Israel pounds Gaza Strip amid preparations for ground assault
description: As Israel mourns its dead, Palestinian casualties in the Gaza Strip are mounting and hospitals are running out fuel for their generators.

title: In photos: The scene as the Israel-Hamas war continues
description: Israel is massing troops near the Gaza Strip and calling up reservists ahead of an offensive against Hamas militants in the densely populated Palestinian territory.

title: In photos: The scene as the Israel-Hamas war continues
description: Israel is massing troops near the Gaza Strip and calling up reservists ahead of an offensive against Hamas militants in the densely populated Palestinian territory.

title: In Israel and Gaza, people brace for a long and costly war
description: The latest war unfolding between Israel and Hamas is already unlike any of the previous waves of conflict, and both sides have warned of more to come.

title: Israel ordered a ‘complete siege’ of Gaza. Here’s what that looks like.
description: The Gaza Strip, a 140-square-mile stretch of land with more than 2 million people, depends on Israel for most of its electricity and other basic services.

title: New Zealand’s likely next prime minister signals openness to China
description: The center-right National Party looks set to win the largest share of the vote in New Zealand’s election on Saturday, but it will need to form a coalition to govern.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky visits NATO headquarters; Russia loses U.N. Human Rights Council bid
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is in Brussels to meet with NATO military allies. Russia was denied a seat on the U.N. Human Rights Council.

title: Zelensky visits NATO headquarters for allied meeting to support Ukraine
description: The Ukrainian president appeared in Brussels as global attention turned to a new war in the Middle East.

title: Israel-Hamas war live updates: Blinken to visit Israel; IDF ramps up preparation for offensive
description: The Israel Defense Forces are massing troops and artillery close to Gaza, a spokesman said, adding that the barrier on the border has been rebuilt.

title: Australian journalist, detained in China for three years, arrives home
description: Cheng Lei, who was detained in 2020 during a turbulent period in China-Australia relations, has arrived home in Melbourne, the Australian government said.

title: After Nagorno-Karabakh, Azerbaijan eyes a strategic strip of Armenia
description: A thin corridor of land in Armenia, connecting Azerbaijan to the exclave of Nakhchivan, is coveted as a potentially lucrative highway and rail corridor to Turkey.

title: The troubling analogies surrounding the new Israel-Hamas war
description: Here are a few historical precedents for a new war that seems to be without precedent.

title: Hamas terror tactics test Israel’s war strategy
description: The brazen attack by Palestinian militants has blurred the lines between terrorism and war, challenging how democracies respond.
